div.p: [Gr]aham G— Proclamns. Sales of land— Sale of Reserves L. Godfrey
Watkins— Letter from J. B.— Mercer— Porter

list.head: with four enrolled Bills— Signed and sent back

div.p: Barrell— Hull’s Accts. Mr Monroe’s last Endorsement

list.item: [Br]ent. Danl— Papers for Senate’s Call— Spain and Russia
Message to S.U.S. Death of Chambers
Clay S.S. Panama Mission— Michigan Council Alabama judge

div.p: 4. V:30. To the Capitol Sun rose 7:46 behind S. turret.

list.item: Barbour S.W. with Rept. on Indians

div.p: 5 V:45 To the Central Market— Cloudy.
6 V:45. Central Market— Sun rose 6:54. behind the dome.

list.item: [Cla]y S.S.—Warfield declines— Letter to Anderson— Bissell’s case
[Ba]rbour S—W— Returned his Letter to Comee. Indians.
Mills— Panama laid on the table 22. and 23.
Wirt— Repts. S. War on Indians

div.p: 8. V:30. Central Market. Sun rose 6.51. behind S. turret and perched on dome

list.item: Smith— S.— Discrimg. duties— Maryland claim of intn. Panama
Brown. Genl— Bissell’s case— N.Y. Delegation. Drawing room.
Cook D. P— for J. B. Thomas.
Walker. Major. Case of Major Houston [symbols] Cherokees Creeks— [Canal] and [Whisky].
Southard S.N— Rodgers. Doty. M’K. Buchanan
[Tho]mas— J. B— Panama Mission— Senatorial views,

div.p: [Call] on H. Clay— Met Hammond of Ohio.
[13 V.] Capitol Square. Met [symbols]. Sun rose 6:45— As [symbols] 28.

list.item: [Powe]ll— A. H. Navy Approprn— Colonization Society.
[Littl]e. Peter— Hebb. Collr. Georgetn.— Parish. duties— Balte.
Watkins. T.— Elliot & Genl Jackson’s Notes. Calhoun’s co[unt]
Norris— his Son to be a Cadet. Letter from A. Gregg
Good— William— to be Jus. Peace— Georgetown.
Rush S.T.— twice. E Thompson— Cutters orders &c

div.p: Seymour— Sen’s Resn— Fisk Collr. Vermont Deln

list.item: [Be]ll— for C. Cutts. Coll. M’Neil— Panama— Calhoun’s [moves].
Clay— S.S.— The Resn. Harrison’s votes & pledge

div.p: Brent. D.— M Lean— W. Good— Instrns to Anderson.

list.item: King. C.— N.Y. Ins. Cos and E. Thompson— Tillotson &c

div.p: [18] V:45. Capitol. Call at Mr Southard’s— Taliaferro

list.item: Cook D. P. West Point Academy.

div.p: Call on Burges—too ill to be seen. Woodbury. Bartlett.
Heard a Stranger at Baker’s. Ephesians 2.8.

list.item: Wheatland to dine— Carter Lee at Eve.
King. Charles— for Answer to Ins. Companies.
Johnson R. M— Judge S.C. Trimble, Boyle, J. Pope Bibb—
Johnson— F. Senate Resns— Judge Ohio and Ky
Barbour— S.W. Transfer of Artillery Regts.

div.p: 22. V:15. Capitol. Sun rose 6:33. behind S. Corner of White house on Capitol Hill— Same 18. Octr.

list.item: Rush— Lieutt. Easton— C. King’s 2d. Offer. Draft of Message— Meeting

div.p: 23. VI. Sun-rose 6:32. behind Lowry’s Steeple— Same 17. Octr.

list.item: Ingersoll. C. J. going home— Comee case of G.C.R
Wood— Letter from Hoffman N.Y. Dist. Atty

div.p: 26. V. Sun-rose 6:28. In line over S. Corner of F. Street— same 14 Octr.
Call at Southard’s— Dr Lovell there Met Jas. Lloyd.
At T. Cook’s Georgetown— In bed— last Stage of Consumption
Heard Mines at Baker’s— John 1.1. Met Mrs Lloyd & Mrs Lovell
27. V. Capitol Square. Walk down Avenue with C.J. Marshall.

list.item: Schee. James— for Consulate at La Guayra
Dorsey— C. of Gough. Johnson & St. Mary’s.

div.p: 28. V. Capitol— Rain— 22 [symbols] [Pa.] Avenue. 8 [symbols] from end of Avenue to [symbols]
J. Gaillard’s funeral— from Senate Chamber 10­1.
Silas Foster, to be appointed keeper of floating light—upper middle Shoal, Delaware Bay
Rush. S.T— C. King’s offers— Captain Webster’s charges agt. Easton
